chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Xylon S Harrison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating A Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED.
Obtain any vocational training.

Complete parenting classes.
Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court sets restitution at zero.
Court grants expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Operating A Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xylon S Harrison

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Xylon S Harrison.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant. Additional statement made by M. Brownie. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 5 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Obtain GED or HSED
- Complete parenting classes
- Obtain any vocational training
- Complete 100 hours of community service 
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- No social media

- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
- Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court sets restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

*Court GRANTS expungement upon successful completion of probation.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Xylon S Harrison.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing due to defendant's use of marijuana within 24 hour period. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk

Court in trial on another matter; case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36; both parties agreed to date and time. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (13 pages) commencing 06-14-2022, by Katherine M. Nelson.

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom.
Case in court for return on warrant.  Court vacated bench warrant.  Defendant has another case 22CF2352; Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent to represent defendant on both cases.  Defense requested projected plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36.  All other previously set terms and conditions of bail to continue; Justice Point Pretrial Services Level 3 Supervision, and no contact order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff.  Original (Copy) bench warrant received.  Case calendared for Return on Warrant August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defendant failed to appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.  Court will cancel warrant if defendant returns to court.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report - 07-25-2022

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court, appear in person with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Glendale Officer J. Byrnes.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court, appears in person  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attoreny Sargent unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Pretrial Services Supervision ( VIOLATION) Report; filed.
Received and filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with U Haul Moving and Storage, and its employees

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Xylon S Harrison in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Xylon S Harrison appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
